critique: This document is an executive order from Franklin D. Roosevelt approving an agreement related to the construction industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act. It involves fair competition and labor standards within the painting, paperhanging, and decorating division in California. The document reflects a strong interventionist approach to the economy, typical of the New Deal era. It also shows a focus on federal control and a moderate tilt towards social inclusion by promoting fair competition and labor standards. There is no direct impact on immigration or civil liberties. The executive power is expanded as the president approves and orders the agreement based on the authority vested in him by the Act.
